Description: Virginia-based hardwood flooring retailer Lumber Liquidators Inc. was sentenced in federal court in Norfolk, Virginia to pay more than $13 million in criminal fines, community service and forfeited assets related to its illegal importation of hardwood flooring, much of which was manufactured in China from timber that had been illegally logged in far eastern Russia.

Private Litigation Case Title: Chavez et al v. Lumber Liquidators, Inc.

Description: Lumber Liquidators Holdings Inc. agreed to pay a penalty of $33 million for filing a materially false and misleading statement to investors regarding the sale of its laminate flooring from China to its customers in the United States. A  $6 million penalty paid in a parallel case brought by the SEC was credited toward the $33 million amount.

Private Litigation Case Title: Robert J Kramer vs. Lumber Liquidators, Inc.

Description: Lumber Liquidators, Inc. paid the California Air Resources Board $2.5 million to settle claims that it sold, supplied, or offered for sale in California composite wood products that ARB testing showed exceeded state formaldehyde limits, and that Lumber Liquidators failed to take reasonable prudent precautions to ensure those products met such limits designed to protect public health.
Lumber Liquidators agreed to a $30 million settlement ($14 million in cash and $16 million in store vouchers) to resolve class action litigation concerning defective bamboo flooring.
Private Litigation Case Title: Dana Gold et al v. Lumber Liquidators, Inc.

Description: Lumber Liquidators agreed to a $36 million settlement ($22 million in cash and $14 million in store vouchers) to resolve mult-district litigation alleging that it falsely stated that its laminate wood flooring complied with California's formaldehyde emissions limits.
Private Litigation Case Title: In Re: Lumber Liquidators Chinese-Manufactured Flooring Durability Marketing and Sales Practices Litigation
